Dear Ms. Boyer:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth did not receive behavioral health care or medical services.
Investigation Interviews:
On 7/22/2024 an email exchange occurred through Group Home
Supervisor and MDHHS staff and based on the information in the
email exchange, a special investigation was assigned due to
concerns of staffing issues and the safety of youth.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/29/2024. Youth A reported he became upset at the facility and
punched a picture frame on the wall and glass shattered resulting
in his hand getting cut. Youth A reported law enforcement and an
ambulance were called to the facility. Youth A reported he was
taken to the hospital and received a tetanus shot and his hand
was treated. Youth A reported law enforcement remained with
him at the hospital and brought him back to the facility after he
was discharged. Youth A reported he was not a harm to himself
or others on 7/22/2024, he was mad “over something stupid”.
Youth A reported he likes the facility, feels safe, and all his needs
are met, including his mental health needs.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/29/2024. Staff 1 reported Youth A was upset over his MP3
player as Youth A was told he could not have it during school.
Youth A refused to give her or Group Home Supervisor the MP3
2

player. Staff 1 reported Youth A was not in a mental health crisis
as Youth A was just upset and escalated from 0-100 and was not
following directions. Staff 1 reported Youth A has a pattern of
escalating quickly and tends to have these behaviors weekly.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was not a threat to himself or others on
7/22/2024. Youth A tends to make threats when upset which he
did on 7/22/2024. Staff 1 reported Youth A punched the glass
picture frame and immediately after punching it, Youth A appeared
to regret it as soon as he noticed his hand was bleeding. Staff 1
reported Youth A flung his hand causing the blood to fly onto the
kitchen counter. Staff 1 reported Youth A was taken to the
hospital by law enforcement. Staff 1 reported Youth A's
caseworker requested a mental health evaluation be completed
due to Youth A punching the picture frame however when Youth A
was at the hospital a mental health evaluation was not completed.
Staff 1 reported she did not feel a mental health crisis evaluation
was needed however she did not know why Sheriff Deputy did not
request one. Staff 1 reported Youth A is not appropriate for the
facilities program as Youth A was recently diagnosed with Autism,
Youth A does not want to be at the facility, and Youth A’s
aggression and outbursts continue to increase at the facility.
Group Home Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 7/29/2024. Group Home Supervisor reported Youth A
was upset over his MP3 player and left the school setting in the
basement and walked upstairs. Group Home Supervisor and Staff
1 followed Youth A. Youth A went outside and walked around the
facility property. Youth A came back into the house and made
threatening statements to Group Home Supervisor and Staff 1 that
included if Group Home Supervisor and Staff 1 did not allow him
to have his MP3 player they would regret it and Youth A stated
“I’m not fucking kidding”. Group Home Supervisor sat on the stool
in the kitchen. Youth A punched a picture frame causing the glass
to break and fall to the ground. Youth A walked into the kitchen
and kicked the medication closet door. Group Home Supervisor
texted Program Manager who was in the basement to call law
enforcement. Youth A’s hand was bleeding from punching the
picture frame. Youth A shook his hand a few times in the kitchen
causing blood to spatter. Group Home Supervisor informed Youth
A law enforcement was called. Youth A paced around the front
door waiting for law enforcement to come. When law enforcement
arrived, an ambulance was called to assess and clean up Youth
A’s hand that was bleeding from punching the picture frame. It
was determined Youth A would be transported to the hospital to
have his hand assessed. Group Home Supervisor reported Youth
A was gone from the facility for approximately two hours. Youth A
3

was brought back to the facility by Sheriff Deputy. Group Home
Supervisor was informed Youth A was assessed for his hand
injuries however Youth A was not provided a mental health
assessment as Youth A was not in crisis at time of arriving at the
hospital. Group Home Supervisor reported the facility protocol
when youth are in a mental health crisis is to take the youth to the
local hospital for a mental health crisis. Youth are evaluated by
Pathways, the county’s community mental health provider, via
tablet. Group Home Supervisor reported she did not know why
Youth A was not screened by Pathways while he was at the
hospital with Sheriff Deputy however Group Home Supervisor
reported Youth A was not in a mental health crisis when he left to
go to the hospital. Group Home Supervisor reported Youth A
tends to escalate from 0-100 quickly and frequently punches
walls. Group Home Supervisor did not believe Youth A needed a
mental health crisis screening on 7/22/2024. Group Home
Supervisor reported Youth A was not making any self-harm
statements or specific threats of harming anyone. Group Home
Supervisor reported Youth A had “flesh wounds” from punching
the picture frame which were cleaned and addressed at the
hospital.
Program Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 7/29/2024. Program Manager reported he worked on
7/22/2024 when Youth A escalated however Program Manager
did not witness the incident as he was downstairs assisting with
other youth while Group Home Supervisor and Staff 1 were
upstairs with Youth A. Program Manager reported Group Home
Supervisor sent him a text message for him to call law
enforcement. Program Manager reported Youth A tends to
escalate from 0-100 quickly. Program Manager reviewed the video
camera footage of Youth A upstairs and reported he did not feel
Youth A was in a mental health crisis. Program Manager reported
Youth A has a pattern of punching walls when he is escalated
however this time, he punched the wall where a picture frame was
hung, and the glass shattered. Program Manager reported Youth
A was taken to the hospital to address his hand as it was cut from
the glass. Program Manager did not know any information
regarding Youth A not receiving a mental health evaluation as he
did not talk to law enforcement when they were at the facility on
7/22/2024.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 7/29/2024. Chief Administrator reported she worked
on 7/22/2024 however was not upstairs when Youth A punched
the picture frame. Chief Administrator reported law enforcement
4

and an ambulance came to the facility. Youth A was transported
to the hospital. Chief Administrator reported she thought law
enforcement was requesting a mental health evaluation for Youth
A while at the hospital getting his hand cleaned up. When Youth A
and law enforcement returned to the house, Chief Administrator
was informed by Group Home Supervisor Youth A did not have a
mental health crisis evaluation. Group Home Supervisor was at
the facility when Youth A was returned and spoke with law
enforcement. Chief Administrator was no longer at the facility
when Youth A returned with Sheriff Deputy and she did not speak
directly to Sheriff Deputy.
State Police Trooper was interviewed via telephone on
8/6/2024. State Police Trooper was the first officer to arrive on
scene. Upon arrival, Youth A was calm and in the front yard of the
facility. State Police Trooper reported he has a good rapport with
Youth A and has become very familiar with him as he has
responded to several calls at the facility regarding Youth A. State
Police Trooper reported Sheriff Deputy arrived and took over as
the primary law enforcement agency responding. State Police
Trooper reported from what he could recall, Youth A did not need
a mental health evaluation as Youth A was calm and compliant
with law enforcement and was not making any statements
regarding harming himself or others. State Police Trooper
reported Youth A was taken to the hospital and Sheriff Deputy
assisted to have Youth A’s hand treated.
Sherriff’s Deputy was interviewed via telephone on 8/6/2024.
Sheriff Deputy reported he responded to a call on 7/22/2024 for
Youth A. Sheriff Deputy arrived and there was broken glass from
a picture frame Youth A punched. Youth A was outside talking to
State Police Trooper. Sheriff Deputy talked to Staff 1. Youth A’s
hand was bleeding due to punching the picture frame. The
ambulance arrived at the facility and assessed Youth A’s hand.
Sheriff Deputy reported there were several calls for ambulance
service so he suggested the ambulance go and he would take
Youth A to the hospital to have his hand cleaned and assessed.
Sheriff Deputy reported he has had several contacts with Youth A
and volunteered to take Youth A to the hospital. Sheriff Deputy
reported Youth A was calm and he felt it was a good opportunity
to give Youth A a break from the facility and allow the facility staff
a break from Youth A. Sheriff Deputy reported he was not asked
by any staff at the facility to take Youth A. Sheriff Deputy took
Youth A to the hospital to have his hand cleaned and a Xray
completed. Sheriff Deputy returned Youth A back to the facility
after the hospital. Sheriff Deputy reported there was never
5

discussion of Youth A having a mental health evaluation while at
the hospital and in his professional opinion there was no need for
a mental health evaluation as Youth A was calm and never made
any threats of self-harm. Sheriff Deputy spoke with Group Home
Supervisor when he returned Youth A to the home and no
concerns were noted.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 7/22/2024 in the kitchen area was reviewed
on 7/31/2024. Group Home Supervisor sat at the kitchen island on
her telephone and Staff 1 stood behind Group Home Supervisor.
Youth A was in the entry way of the facility. There is no sound in
the video however it appeared Staff 1 was talking to Youth A as
Staff 1 was shaking her head. Youth A moved out of the video
area, but his arm was viewed punching a picture frame on the wall
and glass fell to the ground. Youth A walked into the kitchen area,
kicked the wall and hit the medication closet door with his fist four
times. Youth A walked into the kitchen, leaned against the
counter, looked at his hand, wiped the blood on his pants. Youth A
appeared to be talking to Staff 1 and Group Home Supervisor.
Youth A flung his hand. Youth A paced the kitchen. Youth A
kicked the wall four times. Youth A paced the kitchen, placed his
hands on the counter, flung his hand again. Youth A leaned
against the counter with his arms crossed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email for Sheriff Deputy dated 8/6/2024: Sheriff Deputy
was dispatched to the house due to Youth A destructing
property as a result of being told he could not listen to
music during school. Youth A punched a picture frame,
breaking the glass, which caused cuts on his hand. Youth
A was assessed by ambulance however requested to go to
the hospital. Youth A was taken to the hospital and
received treatment for his cuts, a tetanus shot, and Xray to
confirm no breaks of fractures. Youth A reported to Sheriff
Deputy he lost his temper and did not like having his stuff
taken away.
• Emergency Medical Care Policy: Staff will respond to youth
medical emergencies by attending to any immediate needs
of the youth, calling for emergency medical assistance, and
arranging for immediate transportation to the local
emergency medical facility.
• Psychiatric Hospitalization Policy: Any youth whom staff
have reason to believe cannot remain safe within the
program due to severe emotional or psychiatric state.
6

Youth may be determined to need hospitalization when a
youth demonstrates behaviors of a severe nature that
include danger to self (exhibiting behaviors of self-
destruction such as threats of suicide or serious self-harm),
danger to others (when the severity of emotional outburst
greatly impacts the safety of the other youth in the program
including acts of overt violence, use of weapons, or a high
frequency of dangerous acts against other youth), or
gravely disabled (when youth are unable to respond to
teaching and unable to control their actions to the point of
cognitive dysfunction).
• Helen Newberry Joy Hospital & Healthcare Center After
Visit Summary for Youth A dated 7/22/2024: Youth A was
seen for laceration and hand injury. An Xray was taken of
Youth A’s hand. Youth A was diagnosed with abrasion of
finger on right hand and contusion of finger on right hand.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as based on interviews and the
facilities Psychiatric Hospitalization policy; Youth A did not meet
criteria for a mental health evaluation. Per interviews with staff,
Youth A, and law enforcement, Youth A was calm after punching
the picture frame and a mental health evaluation was not needed.
Youth A was taken to the hospital by Sheriff Deputy to have his
hand cleaned and a Xray taken. Sheriff Deputy voluntarily took
Youth A to the hospital to allow Youth A and staff some separation
time. Sheriff Deputy was never asked to take Youth A to the
hospital.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facilities policy regarding communication and professionalism
was not followed.
Investigation Interviews:
Group Home Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 7/29/2024. Group Home Supervisor reported she was
7

upset when she responded to an email chain as she feels Youth A
is not appropriate for the facility based on his needs and feels that
she is advocating for Youth A and is not being heard. Group
Home Supervisor reported she did not realize all the individuals
that were on the email chain that she was responded to. Group
Home Supervisor acknowledged she responded in a “heat of the
moment” and was not professional. Group Home Supervisor
reported she did indicate in her email chain that the hospital does
not complete mental health evaluations which was not an accurate
statement. Group Home Supervisor reported Pathways has
completed mental health evaluations on all youth that the facility
has taken/sent for mental health evaluations. Group Home
Supervisor reported what she meant by this statement was
Pathways will not find a youth to meet criteria for hospitalization
unless the youth is actively in crisis. Group Home Supervisor
reported in her experience, by the time youth are taken to the
hospital and met with for the evaluations via tablet, the youth are
calmed down and no longer a threat to themselves or others.
Group Home Supervisor reported she was not refusing to have
Youth A taken to the hospital or evaluated for a mental health
evaluation as Youth A was taken to the hospital. Group Home
Supervisor reported when she referenced statements of there
being no resources in the location, she was referring to ABA
resources as Youth A was recently diagnosed with Autism. Group
Home Supervisor reported she did make the statement in the
email regarding the facility not having staff to sit with Youth A at
the hospital. Group Home Supervisor reported there were two
staff on the schedule for the shift however she was at the facility
as well as Program Manager and Chief Administrator and one of
them could have assisted at the hospital if necessary. Group
Home Supervisor reported on 7/22/2024 she, Program Manager,
nor Chief Administrator assisted Youth A to the hospital as Sheriff
Deputy volunteered to take Youth A. Group Home Supervisor
reported she was spoken to by Director about professionalism and
to watch her tone and language in emails. Group Home
Supervisor reported she was unprofessional, and she let her
frustration out through the email chain which was not appropriate.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 7/29/2024. Chief Administrator reported she was
aware of the email communication Group Home Supervisor was
involved in regarding Youth A. Chief Administrator reported she
has no concerns with Group Home Supervisor’s ability to
complete her job requirements and feels Group Home Supervisor
was responding out of frustration in the email. Chief Administrator
reported Group Home Supervisor has always ensured youth
8

needs are met at the facility and has never refused to have a
youth assessed for medical treatment when necessary.
Director was interviewed via telephone on 8/6/2024. Director
reported he spoke with Group Home Supervisor due to the email
communication Group Home Supervisor was involved in and
Group Home Supervisor apologized for her unprofessionalism.
Director reported he has spoken with both Group Home
Supervisor and Chief Administrator and moving forward
communication regarding specific youth needs will be handled by
the Chief Administrator who is the social service worker.
State Police Trooper was interviewed via telephone on
8/6/2024. State Police Trooper reported he spoke with Staff 1
when he arrived at the facility. Staff 1 pointed out the facts of
what happened. State Police Trooper reported he did not have
much communication with Staff 1 or any other staff at the facility
as Sheriff Deputy took over when he arrived.
Sherriff Deputy was interviewed via telephone on 8/6/2024.
Sheriff Deputy reported he volunteered to take Youth A to the
hospital as there were several calls for the ambulance to respond
to and to give Youth A and staff at the facility some separation
time. Sheriff Deputy reported he did not have any communication
with Group Home Supervisor until he returned Youth A to the
facility after having his hand cleaned and assessed at the hospital.
Sheriff Deputy reported at no time did Group Home Supervisor or
any staff refuse to take or address the needs of Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email communication dated 7/22/2024 from Group Home
Supervisor. Group Home Supervisor made statements
Youth A needed to be moved from the facility as Group
Home Supervisor cannot handle him and is not going to
close the program because of him. Group Home Supervisor
reported Youth A could not be taken to have an evaluation
completed due to evaluations not being completed in the
area. Group Home Supervisor reported law enforcement
was on the way to deal with Youth A and that hopefully they
take Youth A to jail as Group Home Supervisor and all of
her staff are done. Group Home Supervisor reported the
facility does not have the staff to take Youth A to the
hospital and sit with him. Group Home Supervisor reported
all the staff are about to quit and to find a new placement
for Youth A.
9

• Ethical Conduct Policy: Staff are dedication to promoting
without discrimination, the well-being and best interests of
the consumers of their services, colleagues, and society in
general. Staff are committed to providing professional
service characterized by competence, compassion and
integrity.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Personnel
Policy and Procedures: Acceptable Conversation-
Employees are expected to engage in appropriate
conversation and refrain from cursing or swearing.
Employees of TFH are expected to engage in and exhibit
appropriate social skills with co-workers and clients.
Employee public behavior is a reflection on TFH. Employee
actions should reflect a positive image.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Personnel
Policy and Procedures: Technology Usage and Digital
Communications Policy- Email messaging that might
adversely or negatively reflect on TFH is forbidden.
Communication tools must be managed and monitored to
ensure they do not present the agency in an unfavorable
light or do not otherwise compromise the integrity of
Teaching Family Homes or its clients, staff, volunteers,
donors, grantors, or data, systems, processes, and
resources.
• Group Home Supervisor Position Description: Under the
direct supervision of the Residential Director, the Group
Home Supervisor is responsible for the implementation and
development of the training, direct care staff supervision,
support and evaluation services provided for group homes.
• Group Home Supervisor personnel file: Group Home
Supervisor has no discipline in her personnel file. Group
Home Supervisor reviewed the position description on
4/1/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance of following their internal
communication and professionalism policy as Group Home
Supervisor responded in an email chain when frustrated and did
not provide accurate and professional communication.
Conclusion Violation Established
10

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A youth at the facility punched a picture frame, cutting his hand, after an escalation over an MP3 player. Law enforcement responded, and a deputy voluntarily took the youth to the hospital for hand treatment, but the youth did not receive a mental health evaluation as staff and law enforcement did not deem him to be in crisis. The report found the facility violated policy because the Group Home Supervisor sent unprofessional and inaccurate emails out of frustration, including claims about lacking staff and resources, which breached internal conduct and communication standards.
